channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Streatham attack: Sudesh Amman's victim feared he would bleed to death
item.description: The victim heard the phrase "he's not going to make it" after being stabbed by Sudesh Amman.

item.title: Ryanair sorry it made autistic Harlow boy take Covid test
item.description: The boy's mother says he was "petrified" about being forced to have the test, despite being exempt.

item.title: Rapper Nines admits plot to import cannabis
item.description: The chart-topping musician and another man have been remanded in custody ahead of sentencing.

item.title: Olympic Gadirova twins 'thrilled' at school grades
item.description: The 16-year-old Olympic medallists plan to stay on to study sport and management while competing.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: Student with cerebral palsy celebrates with mum
item.description: Jonny, 16, waited to open his GCSE results so he could share the moment with his mum.

item.title: Bomb threat arrest at Northampton police station caught on film
item.description: A man is seen being tackled to the ground by officers after claiming he had a bomb in a bag.

item.title: Channel crossings: Migrant pulled from sea as boat sinks
item.description: Several men are winched to safety after a boat carrying 40 people sinks, French authorities say.

item.title: Tributes to dad stabbed after confronting youths
item.description: James Markham, 45, was killed after confronting a group of youths outside his home.

item.title: Victoria station bus crash victim named as Melissa Burr
item.description: Melissa Burr was killed when two single-decker buses crashed outside London Victoria rail station.

item.title: Hospital worker fell asleep during operation
item.description: Prosper Johnson failed to observe his patient during an operation, a tribunal found.

item.title: Postcard from Chile arrives in Dorset after 30 years
item.description: The recipient says he was 'slightly confused' when it landed on his doormat three decades late.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: Exams triumph for boy who spent year in hospital
item.description: Jason Ledford hopes to become a nurse after undergoing treatment for a brain tumour.

item.title: Kane, Southgate and Sterling mural in Nuneaton nets Â£10,000
item.description: The three lions on the wall painting in Nuneaton helps to fund seven defibrillators.

item.title: Success for women's skateboarding group after Olympic triumph
item.description: Team GB's Olympic skateboarders inspire new interest in Leeds all-female skateboarding group.

item.title: Blind couple refused entry by Leicester Square restaurants
item.description: Siobhan Meade and her husband were turned away from two Leicester Square restaurants.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai returns to UK from Tokyo
item.description: Galal Yafai was met with cheers and chanting as he arrived at London Heathrow Airport from Tokyo.

item.title: Alex Reid death: Mother completes 624-mile run for heart screening charity
item.description: Heather Reid completes mammoth run in honour of daughter who died from undetected heart condition.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein: Met Police to review decision not to investigate
item.description: The Met previously concluded it was "not the appropriate authority" to investigate Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: A64 Tadcaster: Crane fire closes road eastbound overnight
item.description: A section of the A64 near Tadcaster will remain closed until Friday morning, Highways England say.

item.title: Burned woman found in lay-by identified
item.description: The cause of death of Wolverhampton resident Jomaa Jerrare is still under investigation, say officers.

item.title: M1: Woman charged over crash which killed two children
item.description: A 35-year-old woman is charged with causing death by dangerous driving after the crash on the M1.

item.title: Napier Barracks: Further cases of Covid-19 among asylum seekers
item.description: More cases of Covid-19 are confirmed at Napier Barracks, which saw an outbreak in January.

item.title: Ex-Olympian Stan Wild continued gym coaching after abuse claim
item.description: Stan Wild represented Great Britain at two Olympic Games and founded his own York gymnastics club.

item.title: Appleby Horse Fair: Gypsies and travellers gather for postponed spectacle
item.description: The annual meeting of Gypsy, Romany and travelling communities usually takes place in June.

item.title: Sheffield girlfriend gives partner 'gift of life' kidney donation
item.description: Eddie Huntley has a rare disease and was on dialysis three times a week before the transplant.

item.title: Ashes 2021-22: ECB chief executive Tom Harrison 'confident' series will go ahead
item.description: ECB chief executive Tom Harrison says "the integrity of the Ashes is paramount" as talks continue over England's winter tour of Australia.

item.title: Chelsea: Manufacturing issue could see some fans miss season opener
item.description: Chelsea warn fans there could be a seating issue which may prevent some from attending their Premier League opener against Crystal Palace

item.title: Leeds United: Marcelo Bielsa declares contract situation 'resolved'
item.description: Leeds United head coach Marcelo Bielsa says his contract situation has been "resolved" ahead of Saturday's Premier League opener at Manchester United.
